segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for unique identification of the BANSTA message, the date and time, the type of BANSTA message (e.g. response to an original instruction, to a query, etc.) and its function.

segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the BANSTA message, its type and function.
DTM, A segment specifying the date and time of the status message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the original message to which the Status message is referring. It may also refer to the query to which this Status information applies. When several queries have been sent, the date/time information identifies the specific query concerned.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a previously sent message and/or query.
DTM, A segment identifying the date/time of the previously sent message and/or query.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the exchange of the message, and their contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying the party and its function.
CTA, A segment identifying a person or department for the party specified in the NAD segment and to whom communication should be directed.

COM, A segment providing communication numbers for the party identified in the NAD segment and, optionally, for the contact identified in the associated CTA segment.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail Section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the original message and/or part thereof. It indicates the acceptance or rejection of the original message and may provide a means to report on application errors, inconsistencies and queries.

segment.documentation: SEQ, A segment referring to the original message. and one or more specific line(s) or party(ies) of the original message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the original message or part thereof.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference of the original message or part thereof (i.e. LIN, SEQ,...).
DTM, A segment identifying the date/time at which the reference was created.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments indicating the response of the receiving application and if relevant, an error. It can also indicate the purpose of a query.

segment.documentation: GIS, A segment indicating if the original message has been accepted or rejected with or without error.
DTM, A segment identifying the date/time of the status of the processing at a given moment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying an error, providing a standard description of this error, and, if relevant, one to many documents related to this error.

segment.documentation: ERC, A segment identifying the type of error detected in the original message.
FTX, A segment giving additional information to the error or information coded in the ERC segment.

DOC, A segment to indicate a related document or a request from the recipient of the message, to receive one or more specific document(s).
4.1.3 Summary section
Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments specifying the details of authentication.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment specifying the details of any authentication (validation) procedure applied to the BANSTA message.
DTM, A segment identifying the date and if necessary, the time of validation.
